attributes.action: Public vote to remove the pm and mp's who have gone against a Democratic vote
attributes.additional_details:
There should only be 2 answers if a vote is held yes or no.
If a vote is yes all mp's and the pm should should lose their seats in Parliament and never be allowed to hold a seat again and a law to be passed to stop Parliament being able to go against a public vote
attributes.background:
Theresa may and many other mp's have gone against a Democratic vote to leave the EU by trying to stall, stop or reverse the referendum vote taken on 23rd June 2016.
The public demand a vote on whether or not the pm and mp's should be removed from their seats in Parliament.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

If you'd like there to be a general election, you could sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235480
